Project Papers

References

Almond, Russell G., Valerie J. Shute, Seyfullah Tingir, and Seyedahmad Rahimi. 2019. “Identifying Observable Outcomes in Game-Based Assessments.” In Innovative Psychometric Modeling and Methods, edited by R. Lisstz and H. Jiao, 163–92. Information Age Publishing.

Bainbridge, Katie, Valerie Shute, Seyedahmad Rahimi, Zhichun Liu, Stefan Slater, Ryan S. Baker, and Sidney K. D’Mello. 2022. “Does Embedding Learning Supports Enhance Transfer During Game-Based Learning?” Learning and Instruction 77 (February): 101547. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.learninstruc.2021.101547.

Ke, Fengfeng, Valerie Shute, Kathleen M. Clark, and Gordon Erlebacher. 2019. Interdisciplinary Design of Game-based Learning Platforms: A Phenomenological Examination of the Integrative Design of Game, Learning, and Assessment. Advances in Game-Based Learning. Cham: Springer International Publishing. https://doi.org/10.1007/978-3-030-04339-1.

Kuba, Renata, Seyedahmad Rahimi, Ginny Smith, Valerie Shute, and Chih-Pu Dai. 2021. “Using the First Principles of Instruction and Multimedia Learning Principles to Design and Develop in-Game Learning Support Videos.” Educational Technology Research and Development 69 (2): 1201–20. https://doi.org/10.1007/s11423-021-09994-3.

Liu, Zhichun, and G. Curt Fulwider. 2023. “Balancing Granularity and Context in Designing Evidence Models for Stealth Assessment: A Case of Pause Distribution in a Digital Game-Based Learning Environment.” In Games as Stealth Assessments, 101–24. IGI Global. https://doi.org/10.4018/979-8-3693-0568-3.ch005.

Rahimi, Seyedahmad, Russell G. Almond, and Valerie J Shute. 2023. “Stealth Assessments’ Technical Architecture.” In Games as Stealth Assessments, edited by Michael P. McCreery and S. Kathleen Krach, 61–80. IGI Global.

Rahimi, Seyedahmad, Russell G. Almond, Valerie J Shute, and Chen Sun. 2023. “Getting the First and Second Decimals Right: Psychometrics of Stealth Assessment.” In Games as Stealth Assessment, edited by Michael P. McCreery and S. Kathleen Krach, 125–53. IGI Global.

Rahimi, Seyedahmad, and Valerie Shute. 2021a. “Learning Analytics Dashboards in Educational Games.” In Visualizations and Dashboards for Learning Analytics, edited by Muhittin Sahin and Dirk Ifenthaler, 527–46. Cham: Springer International Publishing. https://doi.org/10.1007/978-3-030-81222-5_24.

Rahimi, Seyedahmad, and Valerie J. Shute. 2021b. “First Inspire, Then Instruct to Improve Students’ Creativity.” Computers & Education 174 (December): 104312. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.compedu.2021.104312.

———. 2023. “Stealth Assessment: A Theoretically Grounded and Psychometrically Sound Method to Assess, Support, and Investigate Learning in Technology-Rich Environments.” Educational Technology Research and Development, May. https://doi.org/10.1007/s11423-023-10232-1.

Rahimi, Seyedahmad, Valerie Shute, and Qian Zhang. 2021. “The Effects of Game and Student Characteristics on Persistence in Educational Games: A Hierarchical Linear Modeling Approach.” International Journal of Technology in Education and Science 5 (2): 141–65. https://doi.org/10.46328/ijtes.118.

Shute, Valerie J., Fengfeng Ke, Russell G. Almond, S. Rahimi, G Smith, and X Lu. 2019. “How to Increase Learning While Not Decreasing the Fun in Educational Games.” In Learning Science: Theory, Research and Practice, edited by R. Feldman, 327–57. McGraw-Hill.

Yang, Xiaotong, Seyedahmad Rahimi, Curt Fulwider, Ginny Smith, and Valerie Shute. 2022. “Exploring Students’ Behavioral Patterns When Playing Educational Games with Learning Supports at Different Timings.” Educational Technology Research and Development 70 (4): 1441–71. https://doi.org/10.1007/s11423-022-10125-9.

Yang, Xiaotong, Seyedahmad Rahimi, Valerie Shute, Renata Kuba, Ginny Smith, and Cristina Alonso-Fernández. 2021. “The Relationship Among Prior Knowledge, Accessing Learning Supports, Learning Outcomes, and Game Performance in Educational Games.” Educational Technology Research and Development 69 (2): 1055–75. https://doi.org/10.1007/s11423-021-09974-7.
